title: Bachelor reject Helena Sauzier reveals she suffers from a rare blood vessel disorder
text:
Bachelor star Helena Sauzier recently confessed she felt insecure about her body while filming the show.

And now the 25-year-old wellness coach has revealed she also suffers from a rare blood vessel disorder called Reynaud’s disease.

Taking to Instagram on Wednesday, Helena uploaded a racy snap of herself showing off her svelte frame in a tiny blue bikini at the beach, along with an illuminating caption.

'Windswept, sun-kissed and exhausted': Bachelor reject Helena Sauzier, 25, revealed she suffers from a rare blood vessel disorder called Reynaud’s disease on Thursday while uploading this saucy bikini snap to Instagram

'There’s nothing better than a day in the sun and coming home feeling windswept, sun-kissed and exhausted,' she penned next to the risqué snap.

'Living with Reynaud’s means I quite literally hang out for summer every single year (and complain incessantly about the cold the rest of the time). I think I need to move somewhere warmer but yay for 4/5 months of this,' she added.

Raynaud's disease causes areas of the body, such as fingers and toes, to feel numb and cold in response to cold temperatures or stress.

Concerned: Last week, Helena spoke candidly about her body insecurities, admitting that she 'drove herself mad' while competing for Matt Agnew's affections

Last week, Helena spoke candidly about her body insecurities, admitting that she e 'drove herself mad' while competing. for Matt Agnew's affections.

Sharing another snap of herself in a bikini on Instagram, the blonde wrote: 'I've gotten to a place where I feel so strong and confident in my own body and it's such a good feeling!'

She went on: 'When I was in the Bachelor house I always compared myself to the other more voluptuous girls and thought Matt would not find me attractive for being on the skinnier side.'

Stressed: The health coach confessed she was worried Bachelor Matt Agnew (right) 'wouldn't find her attractive'

'I almost drove myself mad doing it. It's so silly how we get caught up in our own minds'.

The blonde continued: 'I've come a long way since then and feel stronger and sexier than ever before. It feels good to feel good!'

'I really hope we can all strive to get to that place sooner rather than later. It's taken me a good 25 years but better now than never.'

Feeling good! 'I've gotten to a place where I feel so strong and confident in my own body and it's such a good feeling!' she declared

Since leaving the show, Helena has been busy promoting her health and wellness brand.

However she has been criticised on social media for promoting her 'Weight Loss Trilogy' program, which she launched alongside her sister Alexandra and mother Kathi recently.

Some fans described the advice shared on Weight Loss Trilogy's Instagram page as questionable, and Alexandra has since apologised for their advice 'coming across completely the wrong way'.
description: Bachelor reject Helena Sauzier recently confessed she felt insecure about her body while filming the show.
authors: Monique Friedlander For Daily Mail Australia
